data.title: Gave low rating due to service, but their food is well.
data.text:
Don't have many authentic Chinese restaurants here in Metro Detroit. Hong Hua is not on bar with those in Chinese concentrate locations like Toronto or New York. But comparing within Metro Detroit it's okay. I like their roast duck & lobster. 

Services were poor from front door receptionist to table server. From the time we walk-in. Met a stone-face (NO SMILE) receptionist to seat us to a table. Then come the server, again no smile. Look around most staff have no smile on their face. Too stressful to work there!? How can we enjoy our food when looking on those stone-faces!

Here is an example for you to grade their value.
1 lobster around 1.5lbs. Sometimes you get little bigger. All depend their availability. They charge flat $38.50 each. + 6% tax + 15% min. tip=$47.00/lobster dish.

data.title: .Larger menu selection
data.text:
The menu has grown to include many American versions of food. I miss some of the authentic foods.My brother in law the foodie loved the Peking duck and it was fun to watch the server slice and dice the bird to edible portions. My husband always orders the beautifully presented and ornate birds nest shrimp dish. Servings are generous. The staff is very attentive.
Clean and classic no new updates in years to the decor.

data.title: Delicious Food, Mediocre Service
data.text:
We recently celebrated a special occasion at Hong Hua and to be honest, weren't sure what to expect when we made the reservation! The restaurant itself is comfortable and not stuffy, patrons were overall dressed business casual, but there were certainly exceptions. Our waiter was efficient, but not terribly personable, and there were some language barriers, particularly when ordering from the full bar.

My husband and I started with soups...hot and sour as well as egg drop and both were delicious. We ordered the duck two ways and we were not disappointed. The full, crispy duck was carved in front of us for the first course and placed in soft crepes with veggies and sauce. A fantastic start the evening. The duck was then brought back to the kitchen where the remaining meat was removed and sauteed with sprouts and other Asian veggies. In addition to the second course of duck, we also ordered a beef dish with noodles. The portions were large, the food was well seasoned and not salty and I would absolutely come back to explore the menu further. 

Although the prices seemed a little high, the dishes were all shareable and the quality of food was certainly a step above a traditional Chinese food restaurant.

data.title: Delicious fine dining
data.text: Very authentic and varied menu. Fresh ingredients well prepared and served quickly in a professional manner.   Highly recommend for business or pleasure

data.title: Good enough we come back few days later
data.text:
Nice restaurant. Had 2 business lunch combos. 
Food was tasty. 
Flavors are just right. Soup was great, spicy and tasty.

data.title: Great Chinese food in Michigan!
data.text: This restaurant was a pleasant surprise. In a small town area, north of Detroit, it beat my expectations. The food, staff, decor, and pricing were all very good. While more "American" oriented than some places, it still provides a very good example of Chinese food. We ate here at an off hour, so crowd was small, but it appears to be quite popular. Enjoy! Travel Safe!

data.title: my carry out review
data.text: The portion was very small, spring roll tasted bad, they did not put spoons or forks there. Bottom line, food is not worth the money

data.title: Best Asian Dining
data.text: Always a great, delicious, quality meal.  Service is great but go early, the place gets super busy and waits can be long, even for carry-out.

data.title: Fantastic dinner
data.text: This is THE place to go for Chinese food. Everything is delicious. Make a reservation.. People were still waiting in line at 8 pm on a weekday.

data.title: Exquisitely prepared
data.text: Great selection of dishes and not just the usual Chinese standbys. Flavors are delicate. Fish dishes are perfectly cooked - moist but cooked through. Busy - do reserve. A bit of a language problem with some of the servers.

data.title: Good Asian Dining
data.text: We frequent this restaurant often and are never unhappy. The measure of an Asian restaurant is the amount of other Asians eat there, and there are plenty. This is usually a busy place and reservations should be made. We eat from the vegetarian side and there are plenty of choices, as well as most meals can be made vegetarian. Very good and helpful staff.

data.title: Q
data.text: Food so good you will slap yo baby mama, yo baby daddy and yo case worker cause it's that good. Peking duck is off da chains... Walnut shrimp will make ur eye roll back in head... Duck egg rolls to die fo.... Yum yum dim sum

data.title: Super good Chinese food
data.text:
Very nice restaurant with excellent food.
Service was mediocre, but the food was amazing! 
Every dish tasted better than the other. 
A true celebration of flavors....
Portions are very nicely plated and nice large size. 
For sure s place to return and enjoy that fantastic food.

data.title: Great authentic Chinese cuisine!
data.text:
Hong Hua serves traditional authentic Chinese Cantonese cuisine along with Americanized-Chinese dishes.   You know it's a great restaurant when you walk in and see Asians eating there. 

It is a more upscale restaurant with cloth tablecloths and a pleasant dining atmosphere.

If you're unsure of what to order, ask the wait staff.  They do have a menu that is in Chinese only (the real good stuff!)

data.title: Upscale Asian Food
data.text: Wonderful service.  Great house shrimp dish.  My husband ordered a sirloin dish, but it was not to his liking.  No problem.  A new order for the house shrimp was placed and it appeared very quickly.  The original ordered dish did not appear on the bill.  We were very appreciative of the attention to the customer and their efforts to make dining in their establishment a positive experience.

data.title: Hong Hua Farmington Hills Michigan
data.text: A friend recommended we visit Hong Hua and we certainly were happy with the recommendation! We live part of the year in Hong Kong and this restaurant is up to par with what we are used to in Hong Kong. It is a little more expensive but Hong Hua is extremely satisfactory in all aspects.

data.title: Wonderful Upscale Asian restaurant with great food & service.
data.text: Hong Hua is one of the best Asian restaurants in the entire area.  The menu is extensive with something for everyone.  The food is wonderful and the service is generally excellent.  My friends and I like the fact that Hong Hua has a full bar as well.  The room(s) is/are very nicely decorated.  My only complaint about Hong Hua is the cleanliness of the Men's room.  They don't seem to understand the importance of regular cleaning and even updating.  It's not unusual for the floor in front of the urinal to be covered in urine!  Very unpleasant.  It's about time to replace the lighting  fixtures in the men's room that have been proven for years.

data.title: Where the local Chinese people eat
data.text: Hong Hua has the most delicious Chinese food you can get in the area.  It is a bit pricier than the other nearby Chinese restaurants, but worth every penny.  A very nice atmosphere, fantastic food and welcoming host.  As you look around, you see many Chinese people eating here - what better recommendation is there?  Whenever my family gets together in the area, they always want to come here.

data.title: It's not what it used to be.
data.text: I remember many years ago this was a place to go for the freshest best Chinese in the land. Now, everytime I eat there  my food tastes like I am eating food court quality Chinese food. There's not much left to say.

data.title: One of the best Chinese restaurants in Detroit
data.text: Excellent Chinese restaurant. Prepare for some great food. Peking duck is awesome recommend getting that and ordering lettuce wraps with duck stir fry. Soups are excellent especially seafood tofu. Appetizers are great egg rolls, dumplings. Entrees are all excellent seafood and chicken. More upscale pricing entrees $12-$18. Full bar. Business casual dress. Evening dinners a bit fancier. They have great take out as well. You will be hard pressed to find better Chinese in town. On busy nights make a reservation. This is a popular place with local families so it gets crowded. Overall great dining experience.
